name: Garden studio apt
description:
Light and roomy, opening onto garden, this apartment is private, quiet and secure. The spacious bedroom/ sitting room opens onto a private garden patio that can be enjoyed year-round. The bookshelf-lined den with a couch, TV, dining area, and gas fireplace is welcoming.
The apartment includes a kitchen/laundry room and bathroom. Close to downtown and to bike and walking trails. Special pricing available for monthly or longer stays.
neighborhood_overview: There are 2 good-sized parks nearby, hilly neighborhoods and the many services within a mile or so, including a popular brewpub/distinctive Mexican eatery.  After your arrival here, it is not necessary to drive everywhere to enjoy this simple family neighborhood, and the greenness of the area.  Extended bike/walking paths lead across the river and south through green areas, with extended distance for a peaceful outdoors workout.
host_about:
An avid traveler and lover of the outdoors, I taught adult literacy and English to non-native speakers.   I enjoy winter skiing,  summer hiking , road trips or river trips, music, reading and favorite small children.  History, gardening, poetry and literature, food, agriculture are some of my interests.  Turkey, Greece, Ukraine, Mexico, Switzerland and France are places I've settled in for several weeks at a time.  In fact, staying in one place while exploring all around suits me better than continuous travel, and that's the experience I'd like to enable as a host.  Salem itself has much to offer besides options for scenic day trips: to the Pacific, to wineries of all sorts, cities north and south (Portland and Eugene), the Columbia Gorge and Mt Hood, waterfalls and forests, art galleries and museums.
One of my strengths is connecting folks with resources and opportunities.  At work, that's been my focus in helping newcomers with cultural adjustment.  Helping guests get the most from their time here appeals to me.  I also value independence and privacy, so knowing what guests prefer can make a good stay for us both.

name: Southtown Cottage
description:
Cute fully furnished house! Fresh bright paint, large open kitchen, and fenced yard. HVAC unit gives great cooling in the summer and heating in the winter! Garage conversion for partial bonus room. Second bed is a pull-out couch in living room.

House is located on a secluded looped street, 7 minutes from hospital and 5 minutes from downtown Salem. The home is surrounded by a big yard on all sides. Indoor washer and dryer included in unit, off street parking available. Thanks! sean

name: Chauffeurs Room @ the Villa
description: NEWLY RENOVATED! Our home is in the quaint historic Fairmount Hills Neighborhood. This loft is great for business travelers, couples, and solo adventurers. We are close to Downtown, Bush Park, Salem Hospital, Willamette University,  and Convention Center. We are also a great home base  for exploring wineries and other communities. Our neighborhood is a safe place to walk and explore and our property has security cameras to enhance your safety.
neighborhood_overview: Safe, quiet community, historic neighborhood. The studio is a few blocks from the Salem Art Fair, a short walk to eateries, museums, library, parks, Salem Hospital, Willamette University and the Capitol. This is wine country and we will be happy to share our favorites for you to visit.
host_about: We are an active couple that loves our home, neighborhood and surrounding area. We love the solitude of hiking and the warmth of an evening surrounded by family and friends.

name: Single room in Comfort Home
description: Comfort Home was initially established for traveling medical professionals for Salem Health where I am the Clinical Excellence Coordinator. I provide discounts to RNs and other disciplines.  I also rent to diverse guests and have enjoyed learning from everyone I've met.  This home is perfect for sharing as I live in one section, the rooms are on the opposite side and our common space is perfect for everyone.  I look forward to interacting should you be interested in making a request.
neighborhood_overview:
Well established high end neighborhood with very friendly neighbors. Located on a cul-de-sac with adequate parking and little traffic so it is very quiet. Feels like a mountain resort due to the large and dense oak and pine trees. Back yard opens into quiet and beautiful neighborhood park.

10 minutes from I-5
Sunnyslope Shopping Center is a short walk from my home and has a wonderful grocery store (Roth's), U.S. Bank, restaurants, frozen yogurt shop, hair and nail salon, and more. Also within walking distance is a Walgreens, post office, gift shop and bakery. 4 miles from downtown Salem. Blocks from gas station.
host_about: I have lived in this home 21 years and have truly made it comfortable to both me and my guests.  The house is perfectly designed to accommodate guests as we built the 2-story extension that I live in upstairs which provides privacy for both myself and my guests.  My guests and I commonly share the downstairs which includes the kitchen, dining and living room, gym and back yard where there is a hot tub.

name: Spacious Suite w/ Private Sauna and AC in City
description:
Beautiful, large 770 sq. ft. private Suite, with own key entry. Sparkling clean, upscale comfortable, you'll feel pampered right away.

Bedroom with en-suite and private sauna, full size living room, kitchenette. Clutter-free space with garden patio and BBQ. Convenient West Salem location, very close to downtown and Willamette U., Salem Hospital, wineries, shops and parks.

Fully licensed and compliant with City of Salem codes.
neighborhood_overview: Explore wineries, waterfalls and the spectacular Oregon coast from your lovely and quiet West Salem location.  The Suite is within walking distance of shops and restaurants.  Only 2 miles to Capitol, Willamette University and downtown area.  Lots of trees and parks in neighborhood.  Beautiful hiking opportunities abound including "Silver Falls" which boasts 10 glorious waterfalls and miles of hiking trails.  Willamette Valley wineries including "Wine Spectator" top 100 picks will delight you.  Dozens of fabulous wineries in Salem and even more a short drive away.  The beach is only 45 minutes away.  One hour from Portland and airport.
host_about:
We love the Pacific Northwest!  Beautiful trees, parks, wineries and cultural activities abound.  Our new retreat/apartment will amaze you.  It's 770 sq ft. of gorgeous, quiet space and is an incredible value.  House hunting?  Visiting faculty?  This is the perfect home for you.

We are former long-term residents of Santa Cruz, California and never thought we could love anyplace as much--but we found out we love Salem and the Pacific Northwest even more!  We are voracious readers, faith and family are very important to us and we love to cook, entertain and visit wineries.  

We have a very large house because we have 5 grown children who we hope will visit--but our kids have very busy lives all over the country--In the meantime, we'd love to share our home with you.

host_about: Robert and I are avid campers and enjoy living in the Pacific Northwest. Although we love to travel, it is hard to leave the area as there are so many beautiful places to enjoy. We have a grown son and are dog lovers, love coffee, books, and always a great conversation around a camp fire. I am also a Realtor in Salem, so if you have any questions or needs, just let me know how I can help!

name: Private Suite 5 mins to Downtown /60 mins to Coast
description:
Welcome to your Home away from Home!
We surrounded by gardens, fields of flowers, vineyards and green pastures. The city is perfectly located an hour from the ocean and an hour from the Cascade Mountains.

Our place is close to family-friendly activities and restaurants and dining. You’ll love my place because of the outdoors space and the neighborhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). It is located in a safe and quiet neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located on a quiet cul-de-sac and very safe neighborhood.
host_about:
Along with my husband Bob, we started our Airbnb back in 2016. Bob was originally from Southern California. I was born and raised in the Philippines and moved to United States in 2007. We started dating in 2011 and finally tie the knot in 2017.  

We are both working for the State of Oregon, I am an Accountant and my husband, Bob is a Regulatory Manager. 

We love to travel and meet new people - explore new countries learn their culture! We also both enjoy being in the water - snorkeling and scuba diving. Our favorite destinations are the Philippines, Hawaii and Mexico. During our free time, we try new local restaurants and breweries, hike and camp around the Oregon Coast. We love connecting with new people and sharing stories.

We're sincerely happy to host you. Our goal is to give the best and most relaxing stay and memorable experience during your stay.

name: 2 Bedrooms/Private Entry/Private Bath, S Salem
description:
Our place is a 4-bedroom, 3-bath ranch house in South Salem. AirBnb space is pretty basic— a place to sleep, take shower, and relax. It’s partitioned from our living space. It’s clean, quiet, and safe. Air conditioning and heating.
Self check-in thru garage via a keyless pad. High speed internet. No Cleaning fee. No TV. No smoking. No pets.

A family of two lives in the house plus Ellie and Gus, dog and kitty. Our pets are off limits in the Airbnb space.

Oregon License #: 18-124455-LI
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a quiet established residential area. Quick and easy access to downtown Salem, I-5, Costco, the beautiful Oregon coast, Silver Falls State Park, Riverfront Park, Minto Brown and Bush Parks. There is a community park two houses down from our house. Walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops, pubs, and grocery stores.
host_about: I am pretty easygoing, warm, and enjoy company. I love hiking,  gardening, yoga, and exploring places far and near.  And yes, that's Mount Hood behind my profile picture.

name: Nurses! Room+ near Bush Park, University, Hospital
description:
Walking distance to Salem Hospital!

One bedroom with queen bed and a separate living room in our finished basement. Perfect living space for nurses working at Salem Hospital.

Also close to major institutions for the commuter, student, or visiting family. Willamette University, the Capitol, and Salem Hospital are about 1 mile away and are walkable through Bush Park. Oregon State Hospital is only 3 miles away on surface streets.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is old and beautiful! Quiet, friendly, and safe. I love to walk the tree shaded streets among the historic homes.

There are two mini markets and a donut shop in 5 minutes walking distance. A Chinese and Mexican restaurant about the same, and two grocery stores 10 minutes walking.

By car, there is about everything you need in just a few minutes.

Downtown Salem is only about one and a half miles away where there is shopping and a variety of restaurants. From downtown, the Willamette River, River Front Park, and Gerry Frank Amphitheater are extremely close.

Bush Park is a peaceful 5 minute walk away. There are public access tennis courts, a running trail around the park, soccer and baseball fields, tree groves, and Pringle Creek runs through. You can spend hours exploring the grounds which are across the street from Willamette University and the state Capitol.

name: Light filled Art Loft on Fairmount Hill
description:
The Art Loft is located in the cozy historic Fairmount Hill neighborhood. We are close to City Center, Bush Park, Willamette University, and the Convention Center.
The loft is great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers by offering a private entrance with treetop views. Enjoy a nice secluded stay adventure.
neighborhood_overview: One of the best neighborhoods in Salem-- just a quick distance from all you could possibly want for shops, restaurants, bars, music venues, parks, playgrounds, many within walking distance.  Our neighborhood is a great place to take a walk to see beautiful homes with diverse architecture.
host_about:
I am a retired gallery owner in Oregon and love seeing art from all over the world.  My hope is to visit the many airbnb's that are owned by those that appreciate the arts.  
My husband and I are easy going and love to explore the places we visit.  We like to check out the architecture, the arts and unique shopping (we aren't interested in shopping malls).  We love renting bikes and exploring.  
Currently I work in a studio at my home.

name: Ben Lomond House
description:
Welcome to Ben Lomond House! Guest reviews confirm that this home is an ideal gathering spot as well as a quiet space for family, relaxation or work. The well appointed kitchen, comfortable beds in large bedrooms, wood burning fireplace, grand piano, and numerous spaces make this home very desirable. Past guests include multi-generational families, professionals, and recording artists. It is my hope that you will feel completely at home!
No smoking
No parties
No pets, please.
neighborhood_overview: The home is very centrally located in the heart of the city. It is on a quiet, secluded street in a neighborhood that is a mix of historic homes including the Governor's Mansion as well as other nice homes built during this century. One block away is a nice park adjoining a turn of the century school with playground; four blocks away numerous dining options can be found, including the best coffee house/creperie and a restaurant with 20 beers on tap. Wine country starts just outside city limits and Portland and the Oregon Coast are a one hour drive away.

name: Country Garden Retreat
description: This spacious retreat offers everything you need to relax and enjoy your stay in a country garden setting within easy walking distance of Corban University and 6 miles to Willamette University. Stargazers and eclipse-watchers will appreciate the open sky views.
neighborhood_overview:
We're in the country just enough to feel quiet and spacious, yet still conveniently located for easy freeway access and multiple shopping and dining options.

- walk to Corban University
- Willamette University is 5.7 miles away
- downtown Salem is 7 miles away
- hiking and biking opportunities abound in easy driving distance, including the Riverfront City Park, Silver Falls State Park and the Oregon Garden.
- an hour's drive from Portland
- 65 miles to the Oregon Coast (Lincoln City is the nearest beach)
- Portland International Airport (PDX) 63.5 miles away
- Eugene Airport is 68 miles away
host_about:
Tom and I are originally from the Portland area and have lived in Salem for over 40 years. We raised our three sons here and now enjoy the quiet, natural setting full of hummingbirds, woodpeckers and deer. This place is like our own private park. 

We've got loads of flowers here. Over the years, Tom has planted apple and cherry trees, a plum tree, a fig tree, rhubarb, herbs and tomatoes, and a big berry patch full of blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, strawberries and currants. We like to call it "Tom's Berry Farm" but it isn't really a farm - though we sometimes joke that we could probably open up a roadside stand with all the produce.

Family is the most important thing to us and we enjoy spending time with our kids and grand kids. Other interests include cooking, reading, salmon fishing and volunteering for local charities like the Marion County Food Bank and Assistance League.

Our youngest son introduced us to Airbnb and we're excited for the opportunity to meet new people and share our peaceful home.

name: Classic Town Home on 50 acres of wetlands
description:
Perfect for the single female professional in Salem on health care training rotations or government officials on business with the State of Oregon, this cozy, single story townhome has big amenities for the discriminating person Steps from a 50 acre wetlands and running trails,
tastefully furnished, soothing rooms and sunny deck and patio greet travelers who want to relax after touring Oregon wineries, hiking trails, or a quick day trip to the coast.
neighborhood_overview: Towering fir trees, expanses of green space and a wetlands provide soothing access to nature.  You'll enjoy strolling by the duck pond and jogging on paths that wind through wild space where you will hear bird calls and see the resident flocks of geese.
host_about:
Currently, I stay active with yoga, walking, and serving as an education consultant to students from kinder to university. 
     An avid gardener, I take care of our community garden where we raise organic vegetables and berries.        
    At home, my cat, Julius, is a rescue from the Oregon fires and is a sweet boy. 
    I speak Spanish, having lived and taught in Mexico, Guatemala, and Ecuador. 
    In my previous home, I hosted guests for years through Airbnb, so I have lots of experience helping travelers feel welcome. 
    Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Private Room in Comfort Home
description: Comfort Home was initially established for traveling medical professionals for Salem Health where I am the Clinical Excellence Coordinator. I provide discounts to RNs and other disciplines.  I also rent to diverse guests and have enjoyed learning from everyone I've met.  This home is perfect for sharing as I live in one section, the rooms are on the opposite side and our common space is perfect for everyone.  I look forward to interacting should you be interested in making a request.
neighborhood_overview:
Well established high end neighborhood with very friendly neighbors. Located on a cul-de-sac with adequate parking and little traffic so it is very quiet. Feels like a mountain resort due to the large and dense oak and pine trees. Back yard opens into quiet and beautiful neighborhood park.

10 minutes from I-5
Sunnyslope Shopping Center is a short walk from my home and has a wonderful grocery store (Roth's), U.S. Bank, restaurants, frozen yogurt shop, hair and nail salon, and more. Also within walking distance is a Walgreens, post office, gift shop and bakery. 4 miles from downtown Salem. Blocks from gas station.
host_about: I have lived in this home 21 years and have truly made it comfortable to both me and my guests.  The house is perfectly designed to accommodate guests as we built the 2-story extension that I live in upstairs which provides privacy for both myself and my guests.  My guests and I commonly share the downstairs which includes the kitchen, dining and living room, gym and back yard where there is a hot tub.

name: Sweet private suite and more
description:
Welcome. Need a place for a night or two or week or more? This may be right for you. Your space is about 2/3 of the house. Separate entrance leads to a private bedroom and bath, living and dining rooms, and a shared kitchen. See photo #17.

I welcome people from the LGBQT community as well as people from other cultures. The house is located in a quiet, well-established neighborhood.

If you're in town for a wedding, workshop, training, or business, this may be the perfect place.
host_about:
Welcome to my home.
I'm retired from working in a college setting with people with disabilities. While I am a relatively private person, I enjoy meeting new people and learning about their cultures and ideas. I love to read and take time out to spend at the beach with my friends and furry buddy.   My favorite thing is laughing!

In my twenties I hitchhiked all around the UK.  I have also lived in Japan for a year.
I'm a New England transplant but have been here in Oregon since 1980.

I look forward to meeting you and to helping make your visit to Salem a very pleasant and comfortable one!

name: Historic & Charming Salem Home w/ Mill Creek Views
description: Experience the stunning scenery and rich history of the Willamette Valley with a trip to this updated 19th-century vacation rental. The historic home is located in a quiet neighborhood within walking distance to the State Capitol and downtown Salem. Enjoy the sounds of the serene Mill Creek rushing by while you wine, dine, and grill on the patio. Head into town to tour museums and parks, visit one of the area’s many wineries, or bring the kids to top attractions like the Enchanted Forest!

DOWNTOWN: Oregon State Capitol (1.2 miles), Bush’s Pasture Park (1.3 miles), Gilbert House Children’s Museum (1.7 miles), Riverfront City Park (1.9 miles)
ATTRACTIONS: Enchanted Forest (9.0 miles), The Oregon Garden (13.7 miles), Evergreen Aviation & Space Museum (24.5 miles)
OUTDOORS: Mill Creek (walking distance), Minto-Brown Island Park (4.1 miles), Croisan Creek Trail (5.7 miles), Walsh's Landing Trailhead (6.7 miles)
WINERIES: Honeywood Winery (1.2 miles), Redhawk Vineyard & Winery (5.8 miles), Eola Hills (9.0 miles), Ankeny Vineyard (10.9 miles)
AIRPORT: Portland International Airport (58.5 miles)

name: Private bedroom close to I-5
description:
We are offering 1 bedroom with 1 queen bed. The listed price is for 1 room.

It's a private home where we (husband and wife) live. Great neighborhood. Lots of restaurants, fast food and grocery stores nearby. A straight shot downtown, 15 minutes away; I-5 entrance is closer.

We have parrots, which can be noisy in the daytime. We have three cats, that are not allowed in the guest bedroom.
neighborhood_overview: We are 15 minutes from beautiful downtown Salem, 5 minutes I-5, 40 miles from Portland, 40 miles from the Oregon Coast. The neighborhood is quiet and safe within walking distance or short driving to Walmart, Winco, McDonald's, etc.
host_about:
I am a retired medical transcriptionist. I was the first server in our craft brewery back in 2012 and loved serving people. Previously, I have been a housekeeper for two 5-star hotels. A long time ago I was an art student in Brooklyn. We moved a lot when I was a child because my father was in the Navy during WW2.

Ian is from England. We met 30 years ago when he was working in a quaint hostel in Ashland; a place known for its Shakespeare festival. I was a guest. He lived under the stairs just like Harry Potter. He is the head brewer in the craft brewery we’re partners in.

name: Sasquatch’s Cozy Stay
description:
Subtle touches make this space special: sliding barn doors, open layout, radiant heat in the porcelain and bamboo floors, organic cotton towels, and organic percale sheets with both down and synthetic pillows. Enjoy the garden on sunny days and covered patio when it rains.

PLEASE NOTE: The layout, doors, and shared common space means less privacy. Great for crashing after a conference, not for honeymooners. Courteous single visitors, travel nurses, and road trippers preferred.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood (Grant) is cute and friendly, and the house is sandwiched by an elementary school and Boys and Girls Club. There’s also a church across the street that has band practice on Tuesday evenings- the music is wonderful! During the school year there is a drop off/ pick up rush twice a day but it only lasts about 15 minutes. Once in a while there is a Boys and Girls Club event that also spurs some extra traffic, but the sounds of children laughing always outweighs it. The house is within walking distance to Broadway Coffee, Barrel and Keg wine bar and tap house, Salem Cinema, Christo's Pizza, McMenamins' Brewery, Tony’s Tacos, among other local gems. Downtown proper is about a mile away and the capitol buildings and Saturday Market are a 15 minute walk. Please let me know if you need recommendations for food, beverages, or sight-seeing.
host_about: She/her. I moved to Salem in September 2016 for a promotion as a soil scientist. I love that I get to be outside and examine nature for work. For fun I do crossfit, practice yoga, taste and brew beer, hike, x-country ski, see live music, garden, and read. I'm always looking for new ways to grow and explore!

neighborhood_overview: The Fairmount Hills neighborhood is located on the southern tip of downtown Salem. The upscale neighborhood features well maintained historic homes with an incredible variety of architectural styles. Based on its proximity to downtown, Bush Park, Minto-Brown Island, the Riverfront Park, and the Oregon State Capitol, and Willamette University, the Fairmount Hills neighborhood is a highly desirable place to live, stay, relax and play. Fairmount Hills is also home to the Governor's Mansion, Mahonia Hall, which is a half mile from my bungalow. With all of its convenience, natural beauty and historic charm, Fairmount Hills truly offers a premier location and experience.

name: Central Salem Suite with Kitchen
description:
In Central Salem, a cozy guest suite located on the third floor of a charming 1908 home with separate entrance. Walking distance to Salem attractions and amenities. Enjoy the bird's-eye view from the top, have a soak in the spacious bathtub or enjoy your favorite show on Netflix all from the comfort of our guest suite.

We are conveniently located 1.5 miles from I-5. Salem and it's surrounding areas are also home to countless top-notch wineries and an hour from the beautiful Oregon coast.
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is centrally located within the downtown Salem area: a few blocks from the State Capitol, the local Farmer's Market, Christo's Pizza, Broadway Coffee, Willamette University, Safeway and within a mile of Salem Hospital, Oregon State Hospital, Oregon State Fairgrounds and the train station. We are about 1.5 miles off of I-5.

Please note, that because of our proximity to downtown and the busy road, you will hear some traffic noise and possibly neighbors from time to time.

Free on-street parking is available. We live in a zoned parking area, so guest passes are available to hang in your car window. We receive only a limited number of parking passes per year and they cost $15 to replace, so they need to be returned at check-out.

name: The Little Blue House (in central Salem, Oregon)
description: The Little Blue House is in downtown Salem near the capitol. 2 blocks from a grocery store with a cafe and restaurant 2 blocks away. No stairs to enter! Long stays are easy with the washer&dryer and ample space. On a quiet cul de sac w. a private driveway.  You will have a full kitchen, bright living room with a dedicated workspace and fast Wifi, a newer TV and a private patio. It's an ideal location for walks in downtown Salem. Close to dozens of Oregon Pinot wineries. 50 miles to the Pacific!
neighborhood_overview: A mile or less to Salem Hospital and Willamette University as well as  Salem's vibrant downtown with restaurants and shops. Also within 1 mile is the  Oregon State Capitol&Park, Deepwood Estate&Gardens(1893), Bush House Museum(1868), and the Willamette Heritage Center. Hiking and biking is easy from The Little Blue House, so are visiting famous Oregon Pinot wineries and many local breweries.
host_about:
My husband and I are mostly retired. We don’t do organized tours but prefer to travel on our own schedule so Airbnb places all over have been perfect for us. In 2018, we purchased a "fixer" and after working on it for a year became hosts.  We are 100% self managed; all the work done in The Little Blue House is performed by we two. 
We believe in the Airbnb community and know that it's a great way for us and others to travel the world.

Large 15 x 16 foot room in daylight basement, with comfortable queen sized bed, two large windows.
Large common area with washer and dryer, kitchenette with full sized fridge, table and chairs. Near downtown Salem, close to hospital, Capitol buildings, Bush Park, South Salem High School, and Day Night Donuts.

name: The Studio on Cottage
description:
-Cozy basement studio apartment
-Centrally located, quick access to 1-5 and Salem amenities.
-One queen bed, plus small futon that can accommodate a child.
-Kitchenette (microwave, tea kettle, mini fridge, Nespresso maker, etc.)
-Great tile shower with large bathtub
-Coffee/Tea Provided
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is on a tree-lined street just a few minutes from downtown. Our block is full of families, and it is common to see neighbors gathered on porches together or kids playing along the sidewalk between houses.

From our place you can easily walk to restaurants, coffee shops, movie theaters, the Salem Farmers Market, the Oregon State Capitol, and shopping downtown.
host_about:
I'm a Northwest grown girl, who loves to see other parts of the world.

I'm a mom of two boys. I love coffee, red wine, exploring a new city, gardening and reading. 

Most of my work has centered around youth development and social justice.

name: Capitol City Retreat
description: Our home is a quiet, restful haven in a pleasant South Salem neighborhood! Our home is bathed in natural light made possible by the amazingly large windows throughout. Several windows open to the outdoors and a beautiful view of the native trees that hug the edge of the yard dropping away to a small ravine. Robins sing as they survey their realm from atop the trees while squirrels and a myriad of birds scurry and flit about enjoying  their natural habitat!
neighborhood_overview: We are located in a quiet, safe, inviting neighborhood of South Salem just minutes from down town, Commercial and Liberty Street, giving guests easy access to groceries, restaurants, places of interest with I-5 an easy 15 minutes away.
host_about:
We sold our ranch on the Red River in N.E. Texas in 2013 and headed north to the Portland, Oregon area where 2 of our children were living. We became enamored with the smaller city of Salem, Oregon and chose it as our next home allowing us to be closer to our children and my parents. 
My husband, Earl, and I both love to cook and I have a baked goods business out of our home.
Earl is a coffee perfectionist and our guests always get a fresh ground, fresh aero press cup of coffee as early as they need it.
Before moving to Texas in 1990 we lived in Homer, Alaska on the Kenai Peninsula for 20 years. Earl worked on the North Slope at Prudhoe Bay and was on the original crew that sent the first oil down the Alaska pipeline in 1978. 
Earl had always wanted to farm so off we went to Texas to raise beef cattle, soybeans and wheat. 
We love to travel and have enjoyed several road trips between Texas and Oregon! 
We love hosting and having the opportunity to meet so many different personalities and learn about different parts of our world and how we all fit together in it. We have the same attitude toward staying as guests. Airbnb is the perfect ambassador for our world.
We love the Airbnb adventure and we invite you to be a part of it!
We recently moved from our first home in Salem, a four bedroom, four bath apartment where we had two Airbnb listings. We now have a beautiful home at which we offer one lovely guest room and private bath.

name: Quaint & Restful Cottage (monthly discount)
description:
Charming, centrally located house built in 1910. High ceilings, original wood floors with one bedroom, full kitchen and a relaxing living room. Enjoy a cup of coffee on the front porch and watch the squirrels scurry about the majestic oak trees in this older neighborhood.
A 5 minute drive to Interstate 5, Willamette University, Salem Hospital, OR State Capital, Oregon Fairgrounds, wineries & historic downtown Salem.
A lovely neighborhood park is a half block away for nice evening walks.
neighborhood_overview:
This is an older neighborhood with one of the first schools built in Salem in 1910. You will likely see children walking to and from the neighborhood school in the mornings and at 3 in the afternoon.
There is another unit on the property which may have guests in it but there are no shared walls with the main house. A storage and laundry room separates the two units. Occasionally you may hear laundry being done in the adjacent laundry room but that is usually only in the day when I am cleaning the unit.
The backyard is shared space with the other unit. You are welcome to access the back yard through the gate in the front yard.
host_about:
Hi there, I'm Lisa, I relocated to Oregon from the SF Bay Area and I thoroughly love it here in the beautiful Pacific Northwest!

I am a textile designer and artist. I love creating, nature, learning, photography, starry night skies, yummy tea, playing Scrabbble, Motown music and chocolate.

As an Air BnB host, I like to provide a restful and restorative spot to relax and be filled and inspired. I do my best to make sure your stay is as easy and comfortable as possible.

name: The Bunkhouse and The Van
description:
Some say smaller than a tiny house, at 8x8 ft, the Bunkhouse still has all the necessities for simple living:
* Heat
* DRY TOILET - uses sawdust, does not flush
* mini kitchen - cold or hot water in jugs or water dispenser, mini fridge, hot plate, toaster oven, sink, basic kitchenware
* elevated twin futon bed
* easy chair and TV tray for a table
* NO running water or SHOWER
* DRY TOILET (search Loveable Loo for more detail)
* Use of my Roadtrek camping van for SHOWERING

Joe Mocha Coffee Shop is a few blocks away, Safeway and the Oregon State Hospital are about a half mile, while downtown Salem, Willamette University, and the Amtrak Station are an easy mile-or-so walk.
host_about:
I am an actively engaged, retired restaurant owner/operator and community college instructor.  
My 11 year old granddaughter and two 12 year old dogs live here too.

name: Mid-Century-Modern w/Views The Mulberry House
description: Welcome to The Mulberry House, where modern elegance meets tranquil retreat. Crafted with timeless postmodern principles by Pacific Northwest architect Pietro Belluschi, this sanctuary exudes sophistication and serenity. The passion behind its design and purpose continues to inspire all who step inside this home. Experience its legacy—a haven where thoughtful design meets profound beauty. Come, unwind, recharge, and reconnect in this architectural masterpiece.
neighborhood_overview: Located in the western facing hills of Candelaria in Salem Heights. This mid-century neighborhood is merely a 5-minute drive to all the splendor downtown Salem has to offer.
host_about:
Health conscious, Yoga teacher, gym program, outdoor activities. 
Spontaneous & Adventurous. Travel to mystic places to relax & grow keeps me balanced and dynamic. Would rather have a role model with people who have parallel interests and are driven & matured into who they are meant to be. 

Sports; Ashtanga Yoga Teacher, Swimmer, Rock climbing, Water-ski, Gym, & Lambretta Scooters. Obtained my Advanced PADI Scuba certificate to get one step closer to that next paradise vacation.

I would enjoy sunsets even if I were blind.... You can feel a sunset.

Member of Overseas Security Advisory Council (OSAC) US Embassy; Paris, France. Facilitating communication between U.S. Businesses and the U.S. Embassy in France.

Volunteer Fireman with Protection Civile de Paris 5th: activities related to Emergency Device Forecast (DPS) in humanitarian and social aid and training in first aid (PSC1).

PADI System; Advanced Scuba Diver Certification. The world leader in the educational development of scuba diving professionals and enthusiasts.

University of Oregon Graduate in International Studies and second major in Germanic Language Class of 1990

name: Quiet Cozy Duplex, Great Location
description:
This quiet neighborhood is easy walking distance to Bush Pasture Park, Best Little Steakhouse and mini golf, Dutch Bro’s Coffee, Whites Restaurant, a coffee shop and much more.

It’s less than a mile to downtown shopping and eateries, and Riverfront Park and the connected Minto Brown Park, with a dog park and miles of walking or biking trails.

A few miles farther will take you to the wonderful Oregon Gardens in charming little city of Silverton. Or keep going to beautiful Silver Falls Park
neighborhood_overview: This is a friendly neighborhood where you’ll see lots of joggers, bike riders and dog walkers. Take a stroll on a nice day.
host_about: My husband, Fadd, and I have owned rentals for over 40 years (although we are still just kids).  This is our first try at short term rentals but we are enjoying it very much.  We live just a few minutes from the duplex so we can be there soon for any emergency or problem.

name: Large Family Room, Perfect Home for the Holidays!
description:
The entire property is yours. Spacious living room and kitchen. Backyard firepit. Four flat screen TVs. Fully stocked kitchen, fast wifi, quiet workspace.

Right off the i5 Exit.
Huge parking space.

Gather the whole family, set up shop for a business trip or just enjoy a quiet retreat

*Any questions? Just message me!
neighborhood_overview:
I love my neighborhood because it is so close to everything you need. It is walking distance from Five Guys, Taco Bell, McDonalds, Pietro's Pizza, and many others.

The Willamette Town Center Mall with Regal Theater, Best Buy, Hobby Lobby and Red Robbins are all a few short minutes drive away.

It is a quick drive right downtown. Where you have riverfront park. I really enjoy grabbing a drink at Isaac's Coffee, Gov Cup or Broadway Coffee and going for a stroll. Broadway has a fireplace and amazing outdoor seating.

I love renting bikes with Zagster ($3 an hour!!!) and biking from downtown, through river front park, across the bike bridge into Minto Brown Island park. Worth it!

How far away is your AirBnB from...

- Salem Hospital, 3.2 miles
- Riverfront Park, 3.2 miles
- Market st. i5 exit, .5 miles
- Downtown, 2.8 miles
- Taco Bell, .5 miles
- Walgreens, .6 miles
- Bush Park, 3.3 miles
host_about:
I have traveled to 17 countries: Spain, England, Nepal, Thailand, Cambodia, Singapore, Mexico, Canada, Honduras, Costa Rica and Nicaragua. Oh and Scotland, South Africa, Mozambique, Oman and UAE. 

I love experiencing new things and meeting new people of the world. I learned Spanish when I lived in Mexico.

Lately I have been getting into loose leaf green tea.
Podcasts: Reply All, Heavy Weight, Another Kingdom (fiction)
TV: The Good Place, Schitt's Creek, The Office (forever and ever)


**Please give me your travel recommendations, I always appreciate tips.

name: 1950's Charm-Great for long-term/contract/RN/profs
description: Great area in Salem! Minutes from downtown, quiet street, walk to Bush park, very comfortable neighborhood. This 1950's house has 2 bedrooms with ample closet space, an office with door to the backyard and deck, spacious living room with a cozy gas fireplace, smart TV, garage with washer and dryer accessed through the kitchen, gas stove and many other amenities. The house is easy to get to from I5, about an hour from Portland. Perfect for a 1-2 couples or a small family. Most everything is new!
neighborhood_overview:
The house is 5 minutes from Willamette University, 6 minutes to the Capital building, downtown Salem and Salem Hospital.

Bush's Pasture park is about a 15 minute very pleasant walk from the house. Minto-Brown Island Park is about 10 minutes drive away.

The stunning Oregon coast is about an hour and 15 minutes away and is a must see if you have never been.

Mt Hood skiing, snowboarding and winter activities are about 2 hours away. This area is also beautiful in the summer.

The house is about 55 minutes from downtown Portland where you can find all the big city attractions.

Here is a link to some local Salem sights:

https://link.oregonlive.com/view/5e8c7cf20bbeac2af433d63aeazfc.1fm/4f30e394
host_about:
I love to travel. Greek isles, Panama Canal cruise-Central America, Hungary, England, Germany,  Scotland, Italy, Thailand, Costa Rica, Ireland, Belgium, Spain, New Zealand, Mexico, Portugal, Canada,  France, Caribbean.
I like kayaking, tea, rocks, playing pool, spicy food, getting together with family/friends, being outside, movies, books, gardening.

name: 1000 sq ft Studio apartment. Washer/dryer. Parking
description: The Grace House Guest suite is a basement apartment with private entrance and off street parking.  Conveniently located close to Capitol, University, Hospital, Convention Center, Fairgrounds and I-5.  Situated in a quiet historical neighborhood with beautiful trees and architecture. You have access to the entire 1000 sq ft space which includes a Cal King bed, full size sleeper sofa, kitchenette, bathroom, washer/dryer, and a great garden patio seating area.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is fairly quiet and older. Most homes were build in the 1920's - 1930's. There are some beautiful homes in the area and it's quite lovely to take a morning walk. It's a short walk to the farmers market. Joe Mocha is a great cafe a block away which sells coffee and breakfast/lunch items. There are also two convenience stores and a local bar within walking distance. Downtown is a short stroll and is a great opportunity to see the many cherry blossom trees Salem is so well known for. The downtown restaurants are vibrant with excellent food and craft cocktails. Down on the waterfront, you'll find a fantastic park, a beautiful bridge and our famous carousel. Lots of great activities can be found very close by.

Nearby parks: Minto Brown, Bush Pasture, Riverfront

If you're looking for great wine, food or activity recommendations, I'm happy to assit as I have great relationships with many in the area and know they will take amazing care of you!

name: Vineyard House - Cozy & Modern
description: Welcome to our charming cottage, nestled amidst a picturesque 47-year-old Pommard vineyard in the renowned Willamette Valley, which was voted the next Napa Valley by Time Magazine in 2023. This serene retreat offers a truly unique experience for wine enthusiasts and nature lovers alike, right in the heart of one of the world's emerging wine destinations. Whether you're here for a romantic getaway, a wine-tasting adventure, or simply seeking a peaceful escape you won't be disappointed.
neighborhood_overview:
Discover South Salem's Hidden Gem: Nestled in the heart of South Salem, our charming cottage offers the perfect blend of convenience and tranquility. Whether you're seeking a cozy retreat or an adventure-filled getaway, this location has something for everyone.

Local Dining and Entertainment:

- Lively Station Bar & Restaurant: Just a quick 1-minute drive away, indulge in delectable cuisine and enjoy lively evenings at the nearby Lively Station Bar & Restaurant.

- Farm Fresh Delights: In the summer, make sure to visit Minto Island Growers, where you can pick up fresh, locally grown vegetables and fruit to savor during your stay.

Everyday Convenience:

- Grocery Shopping: For your everyday needs, you'll find local grocery stores a mere 7 minutes from the cottage, making it easy to stock up on essentials and your favorite treats.

name: Monthly Downtown Salem Loft Apt. by Salemstays.com
description: 1,100 sq ft Downtown Loft apartment in the heart of the City of Salem Oregon. This brand new apartment has high ceilings and aerial city views. Everything turned out lovely, from the quartz countertops to the carpets. You have every amenity and are in the center of the City. 1/2 block from the Willamette River front park, all the cool restaurants and bars/coffee shops. You will want for nothing, it is all at your fingertips. Come stay downtown and enjoy some City Living with all the convenience
neighborhood_overview:
Neighborhood
This loft is located 4 city blocks from Oregon State Capitol. 5 city blocks from Willamette University. 2 blocks from Salem Convention Center. 1 block from Riverfront park and Willamette River. Front door opens to downtown boutique shops and restaurants. Full service mall, Salem Center, with 65 National and local brands stores. There is a Cinema with 7 theaters that offers food and alcohol at your theater seat. We are 10 blocks from Salem Hospital and birthing center. We are 11 blocks from historical Bush Park, gardens and art barn next to Deepwood historical mansion.
Parks
Riverfront Park is a 23-acre park located in downtown Salem along the Willamette River and connects to Wallace Marine Park which has 114.45 acres. It is the home of one of the best sports facilities in the Northwest and has miles of walking, jogging and biking paths and is also a haven for bird watchers.

name: Upstairs 2 Bed 1 Bath Condo with Creek View!
description:
With the creek view, you feel like you are camping but with the convenience of being in the City Center. 2nd floor unit with 1 set of stairs to access the unit. Private unit at end of building (only one neighbor)

You will have one assigned, covered parking spot in the carport and a second spot may be available upon request (depending on availability.)
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the downtown area and though it is very safe (the new police station is being built only 4 blocks away), this is a metro area and there are two homeless support facilities in the downtown area so you will see the people they support. We have never had any issues or any of our guests, but it is a part of life in many cities and you should be aware of it, if this will be a concern for you we recommend you look for a property outside of the downtown area.

This is a mid century modern building that was built in the 1964, it is VERY well maintained and well built with unique stone aggregate siding. It is not a new building but it is well built with large units and an amazing location right on the creek. All units have been updated, but please be aware of the age of the building as some people have commented it was older. It has a lot of character that you do not get in a modern building.

name: Emerald Room: Luxurious space in historic house
description:
Enjoy the luxurious Emerald room on the second floor of an absolutely gorgeous fully renovated historic home. Located centrally in the beautiful Court Chemeketa historic district, this home has quick access to most anywhere in Salem. It's a short walk or bike ride to downtown, state offices, and hospitals.

The entire house is stylish, welcoming, and free to use. It was fully renovated, remodeled, and furnished in 2021. Kick back, relax, and enjoy easy living! Or work from home in luxury!
neighborhood_overview: The house is situated within the Court Chemeketa historic district, an area with lovely homes, wide tree lined roads, and tranquility. It's an easy walk to the capital buildings, state offices, downtown, and hospitals. Bush park is nearby with nature trails and recreation.
host_about: Myself, my brother Mikos, and my daugher Julz are passionate about creating fantastic lodging experiences for our guests! We each share in tending to the needs of our homes and guests. All of us are native Oregonians and we love to explore and find new treasures in this wonderland we call home.

name: Bright and Open Home-Jetted Tub, Live Plants!
description: Welcome to the private main level of my home! The connected living room, dining area, and kitchen create a cohesive space for family, friends, or colleagues. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need to cook, and there are two dedicated workspaces for remote work. I live on the lower level with a private entrance, but you'll hardly notice me or my dog downstairs.
neighborhood_overview:
West Salem has two grocery stores, restaurants and nightlife on Edgewater Street, and parks all within a mile of this house. Orchard view park is less than 1/4 mile away and has tennis courts, an open field, a playground, and a short woodsy walk along a creek.

It takes less than 10 minutes to drive into downtown Salem.

Please be aware that Cascade Drive can be a busy street. I have provided a white noise machine in the front bedroom in case the cars become bothersome at night.

The neighborhood right around the house is very safe and the neighbors are very nice.
host_about: Hi, I'm Jillian.  I bought my dream house but it is definitely more than I can afford.  Luckily, I love being hospitable and I'm very excited to share the main part of this house with you while I live in the basement apartment.  I do everything I can to make this a space that I can be proud and that my guests can feel at home in while experiencing a unique space that is decorated with lots of love.

We love our hometown in the Northwest and spending our spare time exploring the unique neighborhoods and experiences in the beautiful city of Portland. Welcome to all of our future guests.

Cheers!

name: Downtown Salem Next to Bush Park Historical Home
description:
Step inside and be greeted by a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The living area is large and the floor plan is open. Each room has cozy beds, stylish decor and natural light. The office is an added bonus for a quiet workplace.

The home has 4 rooms and an office. The location is unbeatable. The house looks out over Bush Park; where you can enjoy the 90+ acres of paths and meadows. Downtown is a 10 minute walk; close to food, shops, entertainment, Willamette University, and the State Capitol.
neighborhood_overview:
The area is historic and is known as the Gaiety Hill / Bush Park neighborhood. The majority of homes are well-maintained English Cottage, Colonial, Cape Cod, Norman Farmhouse, and French Renaissance homes. It's fun to see and admire the older homes on your walk into Downtown Salem.

There is a great kid's park right across the street on the Salem Hospitals Campus. The Park is open to the public and is well kept.

Bush Park is another major highlight. Bush Park resulted from a land donation from the Bush family many years ago. The Bush museum and historic rose garden are just across the street from our house. Bush Park in total is over 90 acres. The Park includes paths, running trails, meadows, and White Oak groves. A couple of playgrounds dot the area, there is a soapbox racing hill, and pickup soccer or Ultimate Frisbee games can be found in summertime.

The neighborhood is South of the business/downtown district in Salem and is close to the Deepwood Esta
host_about: I grew up in the Willamette Valley of Oregon and work locally as a Real Estate Broker. My family has been Airbnb traveling in the United States, Mexico, and Europe and we are excited to host others through Airbnb. Please ask me about places to eat, local wineries, popular neighborhoods ... anything!

name: Blueberry Canopy
description: Stretch out and relax in this spacious upstairs bedroom, with space to lounge, kick back and watch TV, plug in your electronics and work at an expansive desk with high speed WiFi.  Enjoy a brief walk to Salem's illustrious Bush Park, or bike or drive to downtown to explore art museums, coffee shops, and top restaurants. At the end of the day, rest into the luxuriously comfortable bed that's sure to help you get a great night's sleep. Ceilings are lower than typical, at approx 6.5-feet tall.
neighborhood_overview: Just south of Bush Park, this established neighborhood is peaceful, quiet, and safe.
host_about:
Outdoorsy, corporate hippy. I love meeting new people and living new experiences, wherever I am.  I work in sustainability and climate change. I think life is too short to not constantly challenge yourself and you're never too old to learn something new and keep growing.

Favorite travel experiences were Kathmandu, Nepal; Costa Rica; and any time I get to see my host family in Germany.  I'm fluent in German and can get by in Spanish.  I love all colors, except black.  Flowers are essential and I grow as many as I can.  I love yoga, hiking, paddleboarding, biking, photography, dancing, and practice meditation on a regular basis.

name: Talavera- Mexico inspired vibrancy
description:
The vibrancy and color palette of Mexico inspired this space, a one-bedroom apartment perfect for a traveling professional.
Warm tones and crawling plant life bathe you in a mental escape to the tropics, in what is traditionally the grey Pacific Northwest.
Create your own tortillas on the tortilla press, in the full kitchen, relax at the dining area, lounge on the loveseat amidst the cacti or watch you favorite shows on the Roku TV.
neighborhood_overview: 1 mile from Salem Health, Willamette University, and the state capital.
host_about:
Hi! I’m a fitness professional and mom, with a love for travel, adventure, and the finer things in life.
My partner and I, (recently married!!) have several properties in the area, and are happy to host you!
I’m into health, great food, and cultural events. Need to know the hottest restaurants, or about the happening music scene? I’m your gal.

name: Cozy Capital City Home by Bush Park, Hospital & WU
description:
Welcome to CrossBerry! Your home away from home!
Centrally located by Bush Park, near Salem's Downtown, Salem Hospital, & Willamette University.
3 bedrooms w/ 1 king & 1 queen downstairs & 3 twin beds upstairs.
Kitchen equipped w/ all basic necessities needed to feel at home.
Both rooms on main floor have closets & hangers.
We live a short drive or quick text/call away if anything is needed.
Central heat/cooling. Great Wi-Fi. SNES, Board games, books, & movies to enjoy in cozy living room.
neighborhood_overview:
Great walkable/bikeable neighborhood just one short block to Bush Park which offers multiple baseball fields, oak forests and green spaces lined with trails and a great playground for the kids. The playground is very close (easy 5 minute walk with kids) from the home.
The Salem Hospital is located on the opposite side of Bush park, about a 12-15 minute walk from the home and on flat terrain.

Inside Bush Park, there is a nice creek passing through it with a path to wander on & cool down during the summer.

There are several food places and bars within a short distance along with plenty of food delivery service operations (doordash, Ubereats,GrubHub). Conveniently located near the hospital (.5miles or?) and just a short trip to downtown . It's a great neighborhood to wander if you just want to get out and see the area on foot.

name: Historic Loft Above McMenamins - Modern Ammenities
description: This historic loft is designed with a mid-century modern design palate, sourced locally throughout the Willamette Valley - from the vintage furniture, to the stone and wood shower and even the many plant varietals which live throughout the space. With over 1700 square feet, this space provides nostalgic comfort with all of the modern amenities you would expect. The second living room is set-up with a large TV, bar area and a large live wood community table for 10. Did we mention there's PAC-MAN?
neighborhood_overview: Sitting just north of downtown Salem's Central  Business District, this historic property is nestled on the edge of the Central Area Neighborhood Development Organization (CAN-DO) where it meets the Grant Neighborhood Association.  Just a few blocks east from the Willamette River, this areas main thoroughfare is Broadway, which connects Downtown through a residential corridor to the Broadway urban infill area centered by Broadway Coffeehouse.
host_about: My name is Lillian, and I live in Oregon’s Willamette Valley with my husband, Josh. Professionally, I am a residential real estate broker representing Buyers, Sellers and a Custom Luxury Home Builder. I have a passion for travel, adventure and experiencing all that life has to offer!

name: Central Salem Hideaway Studio
description:
Our Hideaway studio is a cozy, recently renovated studio apartment located within walking distance of downtown Salem, the state Capitol, and Willamette University. The Hideaway has total privacy, with your own entrance, full bathroom, kitchenette, and washer & dryer.

Our neighborhood is close enough to downtown to enjoy walking to local restaurants, shops, Riverfront Park, and more. The I-5 freeway is a 5-minute drive from our home, making it easy to get to neighboring cities.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a cozy part of central Salem with many homes built in the early 1900’s close to downtown and the state Capitol. You can enjoy the walk down through the Capitol mall to downtown in just 10-15 minutes at a leisurely pace. Along with great shops and restaurants, we are close to Riverfront Park on the Willamette river, Willamette University's beautiful campus, and the Hallie Ford Art Museum. The Salem Saturday Market is a quick 5-8 minute walk that is a great place to visit and browse local vendors during spring to early fall.
host_about:
I’m a Pacific Northwest girl through and through, lover of books and studying brain development research, and a big fan of bilingual learning. I enjoy traveling either locally with my family to help encourage our boys’ sense of wonder and exploration, or with friends to other parts of the states. 

My favorite places I have visited include: Ecuador, Israel, the Philippines, and the California Coast. I would love to travel to other parts of South & Central America (I speak fluent spanish), and the Amalfi Coast in Italy.

name: West Hills Getaway - prime location, amazing views
description: Welcome to the West Hills Getaway! Over 2000 square feet, this property is great for families or large groups of people. The primary suite has a tray ceiling, large walk-in closet, double sinks, and a six-foot soaking tub.

name: Charming Historic Bungalow
description: This bungalow is located in the historic section of town within walking distance to the Fairgrounds, Capitol Mall and downtown shops. The pedestal bedframe has drawers for added clothing storage with a new full-size pillow-top mattress. The quiet neighborhood and room darkening curtains provide a restful sleep. The office space has additional storage and the fully furnished kitchen has dishes, bakeware, and appliances. The new sofa sleeper bed has USB plugs for convenient connection to devices.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood in historic district, ~ 2 miles from the Salem Hospital, also near local breweries, vineyards, art museums, garden parks, farmers markets and within walking distance of restaurants and cafes. The Riverfront City Park is only a 7 minute drive away and show cases the beauty of the Willamette River with an amphitheater, vintage carousel, easy access 15 min river walk loop and a double arched bridge that lights up at night. Enjoy a stroll around the river, live music at a local brewery or a day at a local vineyard to taste Oregon's wine country.

name: Mr. McGregor’s Garden- Vintage maximalist
description:
Mr. McGregor is the villain in the Peter Rabbit stories. This is his apartment.

Mr. McGregor’s Garden is a one bedroom apartment in a vintage (c. 1900) building. Plants drape the shelves, adorn the walls, and the canopy bed. Antiques are found throughout. Peter Rabbit’s garments are on display, and the grandfather clock watches over the space.

It has a full kitchen & living area, bedroom, and bathroom. There is a large backyard and garden, and coin or app-operated laundry in the building.
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance to our favorite breakfast spots: Taproot at the Old Mill, or Word of Mouth.

Ask for other recommendations!!

Welcome to one of Oregon’s finest newly communities characterized by beautiful views of local attractions, hiking trails, peaceful and safe neighborhood and more.

I enjoy meeting people and familiarizing myself with other cultures. This is essentially why I’ve decided to become a full-time Airbnb host.
I love sewing and creating stuffs. I also like traveling.
Looking forward to meeting you! I will do my best to make your stay comfortable and help you enjoy your stay to the fullest.

Feel free to reach out to me

name: West Salem Guest Suite Apartment
description:
Stay in a stylish, spacious one bedroom daylight apartment in a tranquil, centrally-located West Salem neighborhood!
Walk to the grocery store, gym, bank, dining, breweries, ice cream, downtown, & Salem Waterfront — 3 blocks to 1 mile from home!
This space is great for those needing an extended stay in Salem for work, study, or exploring the capitol… not to mention wine country & 1-hr trips to the Coast! Completely private apt. w/ own entrance, kitchen, living room, fireplace, bedroom, & desk.
neighborhood_overview:
West Salem, just blocks from Wallace Road and all the amenities it has to offer. Easy walk to Edgewater Street businesses, and a couple of nearby parks, including the waterfront and bridge over the Willamette to downtown Salem. Even walk to Farmer’s Market on Saturday (30 minute walk), or to get coffee, dinner, or a drink downtown!

2 miles from Oregon State Capitol, Willamette University, Salem Hospital.

name: Prime Location! Parking, Pets Allowed!
description: This opulent lodge's architecture perfectly captures the distinctive attractiveness of this modern era. In our contemporary suites, guests may relax in a comfortable setting while taking in the stunning views and unforgettable moments. The Oregon State Fairgrounds, Salem Riverfront Park, and Mill Race Beautification are just a few of the nearby attractions. This lavish resort has everything you need, whether you're seeking for luxury, entertainment, or a home away from home.
neighborhood_overview:
- Salem Downtown State Street-Commercial Street Historic District – 0.093 miles;
- Mill Race Beautification – 0.31 miles;
- Pringle Trail – 0.34 miles;
- Capitol Mall – 0.559 miles;
- Union Street Railroad Bridge – 0.599 miles;
- Gaiety Hill-Bush's Pasture Park Historic District – 0.68 miles;
- Jason Lee Historical Marker – 0.74 miles;
- Edgewater Parkway – 0.74 miles;
- Pringle Creek – 0.93 miles;
- Portland International Airport – 49 miles;
host_about:
Going someplace new is always exciting. And what would that adventure be without a great place to lay your head at the end of the day? That is where I come in!

As an avid traveler myself, I know how the little things can set the pace for a new experience! You want something hospitable and inviting to give you a remarkable experience that no one else can give you. A heated pool, or jacuzzi at the end of the day to relax in, or a nice meal within walking distance? Down to beds that cozy and homily. Sounds good? Well, you have come to the right place.

We offer handpicked accommodations in remarkable properties for a  top-notch experience with a few added extras. As well as tips, recommendations, and 24/7 customer support to make sure that your experience is the best it can be!

name: Salem Vacation Rental w/ Yard ~ 3 Mi to Downtown
description: Explore the charming city of Salem, Oregon, with this 2-bedroom, 1-bath vacation rental as your home base. This townhome is situated just minutes from local parks and wineries. It's also equipped with a full kitchen, a cozy living area with free WiFi, and a fenced-in backyard for your furry friends to run and play. Spend your days strolling through the picturesque Riverfront City Park, visiting the Minto-Brown Island Park, or indulging in the local cuisine at the vibrant downtown restaurants!
neighborhood_overview:
OUTDOOR SPOTS: Riverfront City Park (3 miles), Wilson Park (4 miles), Bush's Pasture Park (4 miles), Minto-Brown Island Park (5 miles), Salem Golf Island Park (6 miles), Cascades Gateway City Park (7 miles), Meadowlawn (7 miles), Keizer Rapids Park (8 miles), Baskett Slough National Wildlife Refuge (14 miles)
THINGS TO DO + SEE: Salem's Riverfront Carousel (3 miles), Gilbert House Children's Museum (3 miles), Hallie Ford Museum of Art (3 miles), Willamette University (4 miles), Deepwood Museum & Gardens (4 miles), Get Air Trampoline Park (7 miles), Enchanted Forest (13 miles)
WINE TASTING: Chemeketa Cellars Tasting Room (4 miles), Cubanismo Vineyards (4 miles), Honeywood Winery (4 miles), Legacy Estate Vineyard (7 miles)
DAY TRIPS: Portland (49 miles), Oregon Coast (55 miles), Detroit Lake (63 miles), Eugene (69 miles)
AIRPORT: Portland International Airport (59 miles)

name: Mid-Century Comfort at The Pom
description:
Guests at The Pom will enjoy its location in one of South Salem's most desirable neighborhoods. Your stay will be minutes away from Salem's largest park (Minto-Brown Island Park; larger than New York City's Central Park), live music and comedy venues in a revitalized downtown, and plentiful dining and shopping options.

We remodeled and redecorated this home in 2022 -- quartz countertops in the kitchen and bathroom, custom bathroom cabinets, and a beautifully tiled shower.

See you at The Pom!
host_about:
Hi, I'm Ryan. I practice law during the day and hone my parenting skills at night. My wife is a part-time music teacher. We enjoy doing whatever our children happen to be into at any particular time (right now it's choir, orchestra, theatre, sports, and -- you guessed it -- video games).

We're happy to help you plan your stay - wineries, live theatre & music, day hikes, parks, dining, shopping, etc.

We look forward to hearing from you!

name: Mill Creek Condo
description:
Take it easy at this unique and tranquil getaway overlooking Mill Creek. Large expansive windows allow an abundance of light and brings nature to your doorstep. Fully equipped with everything needed for your stay. Double convection oven, dishwasher, rain shower, touch-less faucet are just a few of the amenities.

Tight knit community, building is very quiet, please be respectful of neighbors.
host_about:
Hello!
